parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To endure severe hardship, be harassed, complain. From talaiporos; to be wretched, i.e. Realize one's own misery.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To mourn, lament, feel guilt. From penthos; to grieve.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To turn, change, corrupt, pervert. From meta and strepho; to turn across, i.e. Transmute or corrupt.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Mourning, sorrow, sadness, grief. Strengthened from the alternate of pascho; grief.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From a compound of kata and perhaps a derivative of the base of phaino; demureness, i.e. sadness.
